Overall decent game, try to get it with friends, or on discount. 

After the first few games, it's not as scary as it would seem. Horror aspect is going to be overlooked, and will eventually feel more like a very complicated black jack game. Everyone versus one guy, you can work together, or work alone, you either get lucky or unlucky. It's a weird comparison, a very general review on less than 10 hours experience playing with friends only. 

I'd reccomend to players that like co-op games.
the game is a bit buggy but its fun and exciting

This game has so much potential to be an incredible game. Having played this alone and with friends on this and a previous account I probably have 70 hours at the time of writing this 06/09/19. Not a great amount to say I'm a know it all but I understand the basics of a good game. Dead by Daylight is a game where its a 4v1, Killer vs Survivors. Now. Onto the actual review.
The game has Is Pros and Cons.
Pros:
- Unique game
- Fun to play with friends
- Easy but enjoyable to play
- Choice of characters and Perks to play the game how you want (Stealth, Speed, Saviour)

Cons
- Killers are op and normally end up targeting a player (Part of the game, but ****ing fustrating)
- Player base on killer side is normally of a "as long I kill someone I'm happy" this leads to camping.. and it sucks!
- To many killers with overlapping features (Invisibility and one hit weapons...)
- The amount of hooks in each map is too many. There has been one time in all my hours of gameplay I have wiggled off the shoulder. Even with offerings to lower the amount of spawned hooks it is still way too many.

The list for both can go on but overall the game has something for everyone. I do wish that the Killers were less over powered when it comes to abilitys because playing this game and being the first to die multiple games in a row it is the most fustrating thing!

Either way, It is definetly a game to get if you enjoy tense moments and a good laugh with your mates or to blow off some steam and kill a few people. 

Happy Hunting

As someone who's been playing this game since clowns release I've seen the game grow for better and worse.

But as of 2019 and 2020 this game has been taking severe dips in what counts as Listening to the community & only wanting to hear what they want to hear.

The Developers of this game have become abhorrently ignorant to the criticism to the direction the game is going in.

The game now has nearly Â£105 worth of DLC at the time of writing this which is absolutely Absurd for any type of game.

The latest chapters and mid-chapters break aspects of the game that made things enjoyable, Blatant ignorance to perks on both sides of the spectrum that destroy the flow and the enjoyability of the game, IE: DS Unbreakable & Ruin, Undying.

And don't get me started on the balance, Oh god the balance. One of the most objectively fair killers gets nerfed into the ground. Newer killers make either 1 thing difficult or damn near impossible.

This is why I restrict myself to playing demogorgon. because unlike most killers you can read him like a book. I'd rather give the other side a fair chance rather than go 'Haha right click to mind game go brr'

The Solo experience is unjustifiably boring, draining and demotivating, I highly recommend you play this game with friends if you want to have the nearest SPEC of fun.

The Grind has gotten worse nearly requiring the player 175 Million Bloodpoints OR MORE to get all the perks for both killer and survivor, and even then you aren't even likely to get the perk you grinded oh so hard for.


Overall I recommend against this game if you absolutely detest Arrogant developers & the current state that this game is in.

But I recommend it slightly if your looking for a breath of fresh air & want to play it with friends.

This game has had years to sort out balance issues. 
This game has had years to make it an even, enjoyable experience for killer and survivor players. 

But unless killer players use specific perks AND specific killers, this game definitely leans in the survivor's favour. 

There's a massive XP hill to climb to get consistant access to good add ons and all the perks. Definitely NOT new player friendly. I'm nowhere near finished unlocking characters and perks, and ive put in nearly 300 hours.

This game was supposed to be a horror/survival style game. But playing as the killer is pretty much no fun at all in most games. 

I thought it was the survivors that were meant to be scared, but it's usually the other way around.

Lets add that survivors dc'ing from games happens REGULARLY as a means to down rank. 
And this is allowed? Can't players be punished by an in-built system to discourage this sort of thing?

One of the original maps STILL has a point where the killer can't reach the survivor and the survivor can block the killer's path.

This is now an edited review two years later.
Creds: Rank 1 killer and survivor
Killer main: Hillbilly
Killer perks: Nurse's Calling, Hex Ruin, Discordance, Overcharge
Survivor perks: Pharmacy, Sprint Burst, Urban Evasion, Empathy

Some of my complaints have been fixed but I've noticed a lot more things I hate and some things that they added, that I like.

Likes:
1. The higher your rank, the harder it is to pip to the next rank
2. It's now more difficult to rank up as survivor(I main survivor but enjoy playing killer equally)
3. Enjoy the lack of DC
4. LOVE the countdown system after last gen is completed
5. LOVE that the killer can close the hatch
6. LOVE the improved graphics
7. I really enjoy finding the Hexes now as they are much harder
8. Love the changed heart beats of killers
9. Like the change in bloodlust
10. The change to what a perk's level does

Dislikes
1. The blood web is completely useless 
2. No punishment for people who kill themselves on hook. (By devs deciding to punish DCers, they have created a ridiculous amount of people who kill themselves on the hook.
3. Honestly I don't even bother with the archives because the rewards are lame and show "favorism" to certain characters.
4. I have been grinding the game back to rank one on both surv and killer and not ONCE have I seen the Ivory Mori(green one). I don't know if they got rid of it, but if they did, it was the worst decision ever.
5. Noticing a lot of internet problems, animation bugs, and glitches. Not just for me of course.
6. I dislike the encouraging of not being stealthy.
7. I am not a fan of the stereotypical portrayals of the asian characters  (racism)
8. I am no a fan of the encouraged sexualizing of female characters (sexism)
9. The unbalance between the power of The Pig vs Legion, Plague, Dead slinger. 
10. I do not understand the increase in items on blood web and decrease in map choice
11. The change to Hex Ruin. They should of made it another perk

Now here are some of my old points in my last review that I still believe in.

1. Its harder to pip for killer then survivor even though there is ONE killer and FOUR survivors

2. survivors have the utility to play in the high ranks and killers don't. To be in high ranks you need at LEAST some form of sprint. To play killer you need gen delay or bbq and that means you have you PAY for those perks(as these perks aren't on the original free killers) while needed sprint perks for survivors are free. (Yes I know about the shrine of secrets and I personally hated waiting for the perk I needed to appear)

3. My biggest issue is with racism in dbd. I know there is a huge base of horny young boys who are into anime girls but I genuinely believe that even if there is money to be made there, that it should NOT be encouraged. It's disgusting all the k pop and kawaii shit for feng min. It's gross. The worst though, is with the Killer named Spirit in which an Asian female is wearing nothing but bandages. Racist and sexist in a nice heaping bundle.

4. This goes along with number 3 but I dislike the sexual portrayal of women in the game as well. From Romero, to Denson, to Yui. It is clearly evident from their decision in clothing for them, what their intent is and who they are selling to. We can all pretend that putting Denson in an all american belly crop top that really puts an emphasis on her breasts and shows off her stomach has no other purpose but to be fashionable, but what it looks like is what it is. One only needs to look at the DBD community artwork section to see what people truly think of those outfits(oh boy do they love it) and that isn't appropriate.

LASTLY Things ideas that I would like to be implemented
1.They should remove struggle on the second hook phase as it just allows salty survivors to kill themselves. I do not understand the purpose in spamming the space bar when you are on the second hooking. Unless you are an absolute noob who is on their first game, EVERYONE knows how to do it and no one fails it unless intentionally

2. trying to escape off hook in first phase should be removed. The whole 4% chance thing barely happens and its not some big ol gamer move that changes a games whole outcome.99% of the time its used by a survivor to kill themselves. Unless someone has a perk for it where its a guaranteed unhook, it should not allow the option.

3. Luck items are pretty much useless when you literally have a perk that guarantees results.

4.  the limit of going through a window should be two not three. in most maps going a full circle around a house is a pain and anyone who has to go through it more is just exploiting the speeds of killer vs survivor going through windows.

5. Killer speed should be slightly faster. Stun + pallet destruction takes so long. I mean on certain characters it doesn't but on The Pig for example, its traumatizing. (yes I am aware of brutal strength and that hilly billy perk I forget the name of but I don't want to give up slots when pallet looping is a normal part of the game). Perks should enhance the game not patch up holes.

Thank you all. Ciao
